Range Commands

Range commands are used to control the range activity and help guide participants through the relay.

Marksmanship - The essential commands for a routine marksmanship activity  are:

 

•Change flag to red, cover off your firing point

•Adopt the prone position

•Type of firing

•Load and Commence Firing

•Unload and prepare for inspection

•Stand up, change flag to green

 

•Cease Fire!

•Other commands

Biathlon - The only commands the RSO uses will be to inform range staff, participants and spectators that the range is ready for firing and when the range is closed (firing ceases). The commands are:

 

•“Range open” or “Range open for zeroing” / “Range open for competition”; and

 

•“Range closed”.

 

Download the Range Commands Job Aid from the reference section to use during your practical certification assessment.

Click on the photo to watch a video of a range commands. (approx. 3 mins)

A range assistant or the RSO will change the flag (or light) to red.

 

Participants move behind the firing point and wait for further commands.

 

If the participants are carrying their rifles and equipment, the RSO will direct “Place your equipment down and stand back.”

Participants adopt the prone position, pick up the cadet air rifle, ready the equipment and put on hearing and eye protection.

 

When required, the RSO replaces “prone” with “standing.”

RSO will state the details of the type of firing to be conducted:

 

•“Relay number __”

 

•“__ rounds”

 

•“Grouping” or “Application”

 

4.  “On your own time” or “___ minutes time limit”

Participants load and commence firing, following the instructions given in the previous command.

 

When finished, the participants pace the safety catch in the ON position, partially open the pump lever and lay down the rifle.

Participants remove the clip (if used), pump and dry fire the rifle once (no pellet loaded), then follow the procedure for safe rifle status:

 

•the safety catch is ON;

 

•the bolt is open; and

 

•the pump lever is partially open (5–8 cm).

 

Participants place the rifle so that the RSO can inspect it (i.e. over their should when in the prone position).

 

For novice participants this command can be given in two parts: “Unload” then “Prepare for inspection.”

Participants stand up behind the firing point and wait for further commands.

 

A range assistant or the RSO will change the flag (or light) to green.

Participants stop firing immediately, put the safety catch in the ON position and lay the rifle down.

 

The “cease fire” command is recognized both on military and civilian ranges as a safety command. Any staff or participant may call a cease fire.

“Relay, resume fire” – after a cease fire has been called, when safe to resume firing.

 

“Change targets” – when the green flag/light is showing, participants remove used targets/place new targets.

 

“Change relays” – participants pick up any personal equipment/equipment as directed by the RSO, and leave the firing point. A new relay enters the range.
